Lesson Plan has link to introduction and video clips for students to answer questions to, work together in a group, suggested student assessment and lesson extension.

This activity includes instruction and necessary worksheets.  Answers are not provided. "This activity will simulate several factors that can affect population size: consuming resources, and predator-prey relationships.  We will look at how different populations can affect one another.  The population graph we create at the end should be pretty similar to graphs of interdependent populations in real life!" - Fulop
Lesson contains link to short video segments, web references,  introduction, two learning activities, final activities and extensions.  This lesson focuses on symbiosis and ecological relationships.
Lesson contains link to short video segments, web references,  introduction, two learning activities, final activities and extensions.  This lesson focuses on symbiosis and ecological relationships.
This exploratory activity contains background information, discussion questions, assessment and required materials.

Resource Name: Primary and Secondary Succession in America's Forests
Description: Lesson Plan contains background information, extension website, two activities, a field trip activity, links to video segments and discussion questions,

Resource Name: A look at the Population Density of the United States
Description: This lesson includes introduction, procedure, closing, suggested assessment and extension.  This lesson focuses on the spatial distribution of the population density of the United States at different levels of scale.

This lesson provides students with the background to understand the importance of age structure on population growth. They do this by creating a population pyramid. This process will also help them understand the meaning of different shaped pyramids" and the impacts of these different growth patterns." - Population Reference Bureau
Lesson plan has three extensive activities. Activity is presented as a link to another page.  Each activity has materials and procedures.  Some have extensions.

Resource Name: What do Those Population Pyramids Mean?
Authors: Japan Foundation Center for Global Partnership
Description: This two day lesson plan includes an introduction, two day detailed procedures, discussion questions and their answers (within the procedure thread), extension, enrichment and necessary data.

Resource Name: Mapping Population Change in the United States
Description: Lesson includes background, introduction, procedures, extensions and variations. "In this activity, students will create a choropleth map to illustrate the population growth rate of the United States." - Population Reference Bureau
Lesson Plan includes an introduction, two detailed activities (links provided for each activity), resources and related links. Extension activities are found on each activity's' page.

Resource Name: The Demographic Transition - A Contemporary Look at a Classic Model
Description: Lesson Plan includes links to three comprehensive activities: "Explaining Population Change", "Global Population Patterns and Demographic Transitions" and "Can an Old Model Explain New  Trends?"

Authors: ScienceNetLinks: American Association for the Advancement of Science
Description: Lesson Plan provides background, an introductory "motivation" that contains discussion questions, Development (inquiry like activity), assessment and extensions.   There are answers provided for the discussion questions.

Lesson plan includes introduction, procedures, closing, assessment and extension activities.  " Students will discuss the importance of maintaining ecosystems and will learn about the various arguments that people make in favor of preserving the Earth's biodiversity." - National Geographic

Authors: Kristen Fricke: Mona Shores Public Schools
Description: Students will explore what causes plants and animals to be endangered or extinct.  This is a two day lesson plan with procedures, an assessment and a home and school connection.

Authors: ScienceNetLinks; American Association for Advancement of Science
Description: The lesson includes background, a hooker to get the students interested, procedures, assessment and extensions. Answers are included in the procedures.

Authors: ScienceNetLinks; American Association for Advancement of Science
Description: This resource is an example in how water pollution ruins a city.  It includes an audio

Resource Name: Lesson Six: Solution to Air Pollution
Description: Lesson plan has two worksheets, procedures, and an assessment. With an interactive video students and air pollution website, students will answer discussion questions.

Resource Name: Prehistoric Climate Change and Why it matters today
Description: This extensive lesson plan has many resources on the page.  The main lesson plan is a pdf file, with full sized visuals for the hands on activity, links to three videos, and interactive web simulation. "In the lesson plan, the class does the work of a team of paleontologists studying a time of rapid global warming 55 million years ago." Smithsonian Education

Resource Name: Global Climate Change: Understanding the Green House Effect
Description: This lesson contains multiple links to videos, background, introduction, discussion questions, two activities and a checking for understanding.  "In this lesson, students learn about ways in which we study past climate change, and reflect on the present condition of Earth's climate." Teachers' Domain

Resource Name: Global Climate Change: Understanding the Green House Effect
Description: This lesson includes a lab activity, multiple links to videos and web interactive activity, differentiated activity and extensions.  "In this lesson, students conduct an experiment to learn about CO2 levels found in four different gases." Teachers' Domain

Resource Name: Polar Regions: Arctic Adaptations and Global Impacts
Description: Lesson includes introduction, discussion questions, true and false questions, a lesson (Arctic Life Adaptability), closure, assessment, homework and extensions.  Answers embedded into lesson.

Lesson plan includes, a power point lecture, homework assignment, practice test and review questions, some relevant microbiology images and links to additional educational resources.  Answers are not provided

Resource Name: Class Notes from January 22-23 on Prokaryotes
Description: These are direct instruction notes for lecturing on prokaryotes.

They're neither plants nor animals, yet they are some of the most important life forms on Earth. This video segment explores the world of microorganisms -- what they eat, how they move, what they have in common, and what distinguishes them from one another. - WGBH
This online tutorial will go over chemotrophs, autotrophs and chemoheterotrophs.
This lesson has a PowerPoint lecture, additional notes links, practice test questions, review questions, and other external web  links.
This lesson has an introduction, prior knowledge assessment, algae experiment "A habitat switching Experiment"  Answer sheet not provided.

Resource Name: There Are Algae in Your House!
Authors: Beth Nalker & Doug Casey at Smithsonian Institution
Description: Students get to explore what materials around the house contain seaweed derivatives.  Answer Key not provided.

Resource Name: The Human Body and a Study of its Systems
Description: Website opens into a .pdf. file.  This is a webquest lesson.  Red text indicates plans for English Learners.  Lesson plan includes introduction, guided, independent, assessment and conclusion.  There are two pages of  handouts at the end, "Webquest Scaffold" and "Website Guide".

Lesson plan has instructions on the left hand side with inquiry based questions.  The right column has the procedures for each part of the lesson plan.  Lesson is inquiry base, there are guiding questions, introduction, analysis, closure, accommodations, materials list and  extensions.

Lesson spans about two class periods.  There are multimedia resources of interactive web activity, and videos.  All activities have handouts that are given as links.  "In this activity, students learn how the human body self-regulates to maintain a stable internal environment despite changes in the external environment -- a process called homeostasis."  - pbs.org

Lesson plan includes a list of material, introductory, procedures for instruction, Activity 1: group analysis of hazardous chemicals, Activity 2: Role Play of a tragedy, and a few Extension Activities.  Extra handouts are provided as links in blue.

Lesson is based off of a video "Deadly Patterns-Toxicogenomics".  Plan includes pre-viewing questions (answers included), questions during the video, post viewing questions, a student activity that tests products for toxins, handouts and answer keys.

Utilizing the information from The Human Genome Project, Olden and colleagues are studying genetic responses to certain chemicals thought to be dangerous. The goal is to create a database of how organisms respond to harmful chemicals which could help researchers and drug developers save considerable amounts of time and money. - VCU

Website loads a .pdf file. Table of contents is pg 3 of the .pdf.  Understanding cancer section is the background.  Implementing the Module explains how the lesson plan works.  The Student activities are towards the end.

Website loads a .pdf file.  "Students will gain background knowledge of the basic sources of air pollution, along with the overview of how air pollution affects our health and our environment. They will participate in a hands-on demonstration to visually demonstrate that everyone has an impact on air pollution." - salsa.democracyinaction.org

Lesson plan contains study questions, matching activity, definitions, procedure, discussion questions, and extension.  Overview of Smallpox: What is a vaccine? Students will become familiar with the topic by examining the features of smallpox, the benefits and risks of the Smallpox vaccination, and the policy recommendations for dealing with the threat posed by weaponized smallpox.

Resource Name: Lesson 1 - Biological and Chemical Terrorism: Becoming Prepared
Description: This lesson plan is where students explore questions, and research them on the web.  There are five extension options and resources at the end.

Authors: Mitchell High School: Health Occupations Education
Description: Link opens to a .pdf. file.  This a unit lesson comprising five 90 minute classes or  ten 55 minute classes.  The each lesson has seven main components, Focus and Review, Statement of Objectives, Teacher Input, Guided Practice, Independent Practice, Closure and Materials.
Lesson contains an outline, guided practice, independent practice, review, evaluation, and PowerPoint Presentation.  Answer key provided for the exam.

Lesson includes a materials list, procedures (introduction and discussion questions, direct instruction and an activity that requires students to draw a cartoon strip), adaptation to have students create a visual time line of a healing bone, discussion questions, evaluation, a few extension activities, readings and additional links.
Activity is part of a lesson plan on page 3 of 4.  It  includes a materials list, activity, two extensions, and a link for the reproducible materials.
Here students build their own joint and muscle assembly.  This lesson plan has a list of materials, introduction to the activity, instructions, closing, extension/homework.

Authors: School of Medicone UT Health Science Center, San Antonio
Description: This lesson is part of a unit called Give Your Bones a break.  All extra instructions and handouts are provided as links in blue.  It has six bone density activities, an introduction, objectives and web resources.

Authors: Mitchell High School: Health Occupations Education
Description: Lesson One will be on the various muscle structures.  Lesson Two is on the functions of muscles.  The last three lessons are focused on the characteristics and treatment of common muscle disorders.

Resource Name: Muscular Dystrophy: A Walk in Their Shoes
Description: Lesson plan includes a list of materials, procedures (teacher preparation and web resources), introduction,  conclusion, assessment (formal. informal and rubric included), and modifications.   "This lesson focuses on empathy. Students in the classroom will be exposed to one aspect of muscular dystrophy and experience some of what it feels like to have muscular dystrophy through a modeling activity." - Garcia.

Lesson plan is based off of a video called, "The Ultimate Guide: Human Body".  Lesson includes objectives, a list of materials, procedures (pre-viewing questions, questions  during and after the film, links to handouts), and evaluation.

Authors: YouTube User: Mr. ANATOMY, Discovery Education
Description: This link brings you to a YouTube Playlist of five sequential videos.  Here are the list of the videos: UGHB01, UGHB02, UGHB03, UGHB04, and UGHB05.

Resource Name: Muscles Lesson Plan using Multiple Intelligence & Project Based Learning
Description: Link will download a .pdf. file.  Students are to create a video on the various types of muscle movements throughout the body.  Instructions start at page 6, with instructions on procedures, implementation, process and a rubric is provided at the end of the document.

Students understand the various muscle movements by flexing their arm muscles in an experiment.  Lesson plan includes a list of materials, procedures, adaptation for older students, discussion questions, evaluation, extensions, suggested readings and web resources.

Scroll down 2/3 of the way down the webpage to get to the "Project" heading.  Activity includes description of needed materials, instructions, method of assessment and extension activity.  There is no handout.  It is recommended to have a handout with parameters to guide students.

Resource Name: Skeletal Muscle Structure and Contraction at the Molecular Level
Description: Link downloads a Microsoft Word file.  Lesson includes an introduction, list of materials, link to a Prezi presentation, interactive online filament labeling activity, Youtube Video, assessment (to create a model of muscle contraction),
Lesson plan stands alone and is part of a larger unit "Skin Deep Project". It includes background information, motivational, development, assessment and extensions.

Lesson opens with discussion questions to grab student attention, assessment, and extensions.  All handouts are linked in blue.  "In this lesson, students will learn about the factors that determine skin color and how adaptation and natural selection contribute to its variation." - ScienceNetLinks

Lesson includes, background, motivational discussion questions, Develop activity (answers to questions provided here), assessments, extensions, and related resources. All readings and handouts are provided as blue links. "To learn about the damaging effects of sunburns and tanning, and how sunscreens work to protect us from the sunâs harmful UV rays." - ScienceNetLinks

Lesson plan includes introduction, outline, text for the PowerPoint slides, application, evaluation and extension activities.  At the end are power point handouts, exam and exam answer key. "(T)he student will be able to identify...the key components of the nervous system and understand how nerves affect different parts of the body." - Texas Trade and Industrial Education

Lesson plan includes materials, procedures, discussion questions, adaptation, vocabulary, evaluations, extensions and links to external web resources.  Students will demonstrate their understanding of nerve cells by researching which method of imaging (position emission tomography, magnetic resonance imaging, magnetic source imaging and gene diagnosis) is best for diagnosis.

Resource Name: An Overview of the Parts of the Nervous System
Description: This lesson will present suggestive approaches in teaching the Nervous system.  Direct Instruction.
This activity is an opportunity for students to act out the parts of the nervous system and its reaction.

The link will bring you to a webpage that has four lessons: 1. Anatomy and Physiology of the Brain. 2. The Nervous System: Central and Peripheral, 3. The Neuron: Structure and Function, 4. Disorders of the Brain and Nervous System.

Resource Name: The Incredible Human Body: The Five Senses
Description: Students will 1. understand how each of the five senses works and define the related terminology. 2.  compare and contrast the means by which the senses gather information about the world. 3. investigate a research question, analyze the results, and present the findings - Brown

Lesson is part of a large Nervous System Unit contains 12 periods of 55 minute classes.  Topics in the unit are: describe the structure of the brain, spinal cord and nerves; analyze the function of the nervous system; analyze characteristics and treatments of common nervous system disorders, and analyze the anatomy and physiology of the nervous system.

Lesson plan includes introduction, modeling, prompting questions, two days of direct instruction, guided practice, individual practice, homework and closure.  "Identify the location, function and structure of the heart. Demonstrate the overall distribution of blood in the circulatory system followed by a brief overview of arteries and veins." - M. Divya

These lessons are based on the series of three videos about the human heart.  On the left side menu, has tabs to take you to each episode lesson.   You do need Adobe flash to play the "Tour of the Heart".  Video clips require Windows Media player (which can be added as an extension to your browser.)

There are 8 mini lessons, where they are hands on lab like activities that explore the heart.  Depending on how you teaching this, it can be made into an inquiry based activity.  Here is a quick synopsis of the lessons: measuring pulse rate, heart rate per minute, blood pressure, heart sound, heart pumps and valves, and heart structure.

Lesson plan duration is from two to three class periods.   Lesson includes multimedia (videos, html document, flash interactive, and pdf), materials, procedures, and discussion questions.  "In this activity, students explore the interrelationship of structure and function in the circulatory system." - Teachers' Domain

Students will explore the path that blood takes through the heart and lungs and study the exchange of oxygen and carbon dioxide that takes place in the lungs.  Students will create a circulatory system presentations that use SMART Board technology - Teachercreatedmaterials.

Resource Name: You Gotta Have Heart: Congenital Heart Defects and Heart Surgery
Description: This lab is estimated to about 2 hours.  What can be limiting are the supply of sheep or cow hearts.  Lab includes materials, procedures, introduction, conclusion, assessments, modifications, and answer key for the assessments.

The first page is an overview, at the end will be a link to the procedures to the two activities and extensions.  "Students will explore both the scientific and cultural aspects of blood. They will create a model of the human heart; research, create, and stage a mock interview with a significant historical figure who furthered our knowledge of blood; and learn about the process of blood donation." - pbs.org
This program is similar to a lecture/direct instruction about the blood and circulation system.
This extensive lesson plan is split into five (90 min) or 11 (55min) lessons. Each lesson has a focus/review, objective, teaching input, guided practice, independent practice, closure and materials.

This overview lung activity requires space for students to run around.  If your classroom is not big enough, find an alternate space. There are discussion questions, materials, directions and a visual on the game.
This crossword puzzle can be downloaded or done online.   The words are epiglottis, trachea, aveoli, bronchi, cleans, oxygen, lobes, nose, bronchioles and capillaries

This hands on lab is to demonstrate how the lung works with a diaphragm.  Activity includes background on content, motivation, background information questions, instructions, discussion questions, assessment, and Extensions.
Lesson includes, materials, direct instruction, demonstration of emphysema, writing activity, discussion questions, evaluation, extensions, suggested readings and vocabulary.

Resource Name: Air Pollution Tragedy: A Case Study
Description: Lesson is in a pdf format.  Lesson includes materials, vocabulary, timing and student grouping, procedure, teacher background, closure, assessment, extension, homework and related sources.
This webpage has information about each PowerPoint slide on cancer.  (1- 63).  On the left hand side there are a variety of options to view the slides as a ppt, pdf, or doc.

Lesson contains materials, explanations, directions, and rubric.  Rubric is found towards the end as a link in purple. Students work in cooperative groups to design a theme park called Gastro World, based on the anatomy and physiology of the digestive system.

Lesson plan includes materials, procedures, evaluation, and vocabulary, "Students will research one common problem of the digestive system, such as constipation, gas, lactose intolerance, or ulcers create a brochure, similar to one found at a doctor's office, that describes the problem, its causes, symptoms, and possible treatments" - Brewster

Lesson plan pulls up as a pdf. file.   Lesson contains materials, focus lesson, introduction, procedure, closure and assessment.  Students to get to experience how food is broken down from the mouth down to all of the organs it goes through.

Resource Name: When food Becomes an Enemy: Eating Disorders
Description: Lesson includes objectives, procedures, adaptations, discussion questions, evaluation, extensions, Suggested readings, extra resources and vocabulary.   This lesson is planned for two periods.

Authors: Simone Bloom Nathan of Media Education Consultants: pbs.org
Description: Lesson has a paragraph synopsis of the video, pre-viewing lesson plan, viewing the lesson plan, post viewing the lesson, and extension.  The video is called "Diet Wars" by pbs.org

Resource Name: 1 of 5 Gary Taubes on PBS Frontline "Diet Wars"
Description: Video is 1 of 5 videos. This video is on a playlist, so it will automatically play one after the other.

Activity includes materials, procedure, activity answer sand links to books and websites.  "To collect and analyze data about how healthy men and women are portrayed in the media and use this data to learn more about healthy lifestyles." - Nova Teachers

Lesson includes slide by slide comments.  If there are activities, they are indicated in the margins.  On completion of this course, the learner will demonstrate knowledge and skills needed to incorporate the principles of sound nutrition into their personal lives.

Resource Name: Fast Fats: A Nutritional Analysis of America's Obsession.
Description: Lesson plan includes, materials, pre-lesson activity, three activities (Nutrition Labels, Calories & Fat, School Surveys). "In this three part lesson, students will examine nutrition labels for caloric intake using various snack foods." - Rachelle Kean

Lesson plan includes material, background, instructional procedures, There are 13 different activities listed. All additional materials are presented as links within the web page. "Food categories supporting the selection of foods providing the six basic nutrients that keep the body healthy." - Utah Education Network

Lesson plan includes a detailed summary, procedure, rubric for assessment, and role play example.  "This lesson is a simulation.  You and a friend have a new recipe that you want to market.  Youâll have to prepare a label and get it approved by the Federal Food Drug and Cosmetic Act."  - Children's Hospital

Authors: Health Occupations Education: Mitchell High School: North Carolina
Description: Lessons addresses the structures of the Urinary System, function of the Urinary System, and Urinary disorders.
A woman lectures with power point slides on the Urinary Systems' structure and function. On the bottom of the video there is an "Interactive Transcript" button that can help with note taking.
The quiz questions are related to the video.  There are three different ones.  Each one are interactive and requires the user to match the potential answer to the vocabulary.

Activity is interactive where the user can drag a term to a diagram to match the correct location.  This is for matching terms for the Urinary System.  Answers are not provided, however the label won't stick to the right place if it is not correct.  There is a print tab on the right side.

The weblink will take you to an automatic download to a word document.  The lesson plan includes a scope and sequence of four lessons; with an objective, student activities, materials and assessment.  All handouts are found respectively after each lesson procedures.

This unit has 3 lessons: The Parts of the Urinary System and How they Work, Diseases of the Urinary System, and Taking Care of the Urinary System.  There is a pre-test, handout on identifying the Urinary System, review, quiz, discussion questions, crossword puzzle, Answers key are provided at the end of the document.

There are five parts to the video.  There are chapter indicators in the upper left hand corner for reference.  "Osmoregulation, the control of water balance in animals, and excretion, the bodyâs waste disposal system, are closely related processes. In this Lesson, weâll look at how animals regulate the concentration of their body fluids, and how waste materials are excreted by mechanisms of active transport." - NROC
Lesson plan includes an introduction, exploration (activities take you to an interactive website, and readings), creating a comic strip, All necessary materials are provided as links in blue.

Web address opens to a .pdf document.  This lesson plan has seven various activities. "The unitâs introductory lab âWhatâs Living in My Mouthâ will raise student awareness of the positive and negative benefits of the numerous bacteria that call our surroundings home and inhabit our own body." - Baier & Schug

Resource Name: Critical Content to defend your Immune System
Description: Lesson can be adapted for 9th - 12th graders.  The lesson includes an immune game, students making a flipbook about the immune system, discussion questions, and produce a play.

Resource Name: The Immune System: Defenders of our Health
Description: Link takes you to a 55 pages in .pdf format.  Lesson includes background, equipment, introductory discussion (questions included), internet search activity, Direct instruction on the science background, webquest of the chemokine/neutrophil connection, analyzing neutrophill/chemokine connection, and ELISA lab test (pre-lab and preparation activity are included).

Authors: Health Occupations Education: Mitchell High School
Description: Unit shows up as a pdf document.  Unit includes 5 (90 minute classes) or 11 (55 minute classes). Unit includes a detailed outline, the five lessons and transparency.  Each lesson contains, a focus and review, objective, teacher input, guided practice, independent practice, closure and materials.

Lesson plan includes materials, procedures in teaching students a case study acting activity, discussion questions, evaluation, extensions, and content related links. If there are any materials needed, they are provided as links in blue.  There is also an option for educators to adapt this lesson for younger learners.

Resource Name: Lesson 6 Cell-mediated Immunity Lesson Plan Eng F1
Description: Lesson starts off with a review of innate and adaptive immunity, direct instruction (power point is a separate document), case study activity, evaluation and suggested reading.

Description: Powerpoint on T Cell mediated immunity

Resource Name: Using the History of Vaccines in the Classroom
Description: Link will bring you to a .pdf file.  Lesson plan spans about two 50 minute class periods.  It includes introductory activity to discussion diseases and diseases, procedures, closures and assessments for Plan A and B.  Extensions are available.  Supplementary materials are found after page 3.
Interactive web activity has the following activities, Response to vaccine, response to pathogen and vaccine response are the headings.

Click on the screen to start the game.  "Games can teach valuable lessons, and in this exciting game students race to protect the population from Illsville from disease while attempting to gain the medical knowledge necessary to develop vaccines. Students learn about history, disease, and public health while progressing from the Age of Disease to the Age of Vaccines." - History of Vaccines
In this timeline, if you click on the picture, it'll pop up and give information on what and where a vaccination has made history.

Lesson plan is based on a discover video.  "Program Description: It hurts to get stung by a  wasp, but itâs dangerous if you happen to be  allergic to them. Learn why a sting may be just a  pain to one person but cause an extreme histaminic responseâand even deathâin another." - Discover Education.

Resource Name: Body Story - Episode 7 - Part 1 of 4 - Out of Control
Authors: Discovery Channel: posted by Youtube User: Flixwest
Description: Body Story is an educational science series focused on the human body and the biological processes it undergoes during distinct life events. The series has been praised equally for its educational content, impressive visual graphics, and engaging human stories. Produced by Wall To Wall for the Discovery Channel, episodes 1-3 were released in 1998 and episodes 4-7 were released in 2001. - Youtube User: Flixwest

Resource Name: Autoimmunity â When the Good Turns Bad

Power point is on autoimmunity.  Speaker notes are included.
Lesson plan has an outline for a Powerpoint (define, symptoms, treatments, benefits of exercise), application activity to mimic multiple sclerosis, and assessment.

Unit plan duration is about 5 hours.  Each step of the plan has detailed web resources and handouts (found at the end of the document), There is the introduction, Step 2, 3 & conclusion: Glucose Regulation Activity and assessment: evaluating glucose management based on given physiological scenarios.

Authors: Microbiology and Immunology: Gale Cengage, www.enotes.com
Description: Facts for creating a direct instruction activity and/or presentation

Lesson includes a list of materials, procedures in how to lead a discussion in the origin of AIDS and facts, how are AIDS transmitted and prevention, group research, and discussion questions.  A transformative piece to have students make a AIDS awareness campaign.

Lesson includes a list of materials, procedures in how to lead a discussion about AIDS and HIV and the difference between the two, group research, and discussion questions.  A transformative piece to have students make a AIDS awareness campaign.  A three point rubric is described with two extension activities and suggested readings.
